H0.text: Which lake in the Lake District is separated from Crummock Water by a narrow alluvial flat. Ullswater

H1.text: Which lake in the Lake District is separated from Crummock Water by a narrow alluvial flat. Windermere

H2.text: Which lake in the Lake District is separated from Crummock Water by a narrow alluvial flat. Coniston Water

H3.text: Which lake in the Lake District is separated from Crummock Water by a narrow alluvial flat. Buttermere

A4.text: Its primary outflow is Buttermere Dubs, a short stream which connects the lake to Crummock Water.

A5.text: The village of Buttermere stands at the north-western end of the lake, and beyond this is Crummock Water.
